text: Rosmarie Kurz (born 27 April 1940) is a Swiss cross-country skier, and road cyclist. Kurz was an endurance athlete, and won the Engadin Skimarathon six times in a row between 1972 and 1977. As a cyclist she competed at the 1981 UCI Road World Championships and 1982 UCI Road World Championships. She played for TC Rot-Weiss Winterthur, in tennis. == References == Category:1940 births Category:Swiss tennis players Category:Swiss cyclists Category:Sportspeople from the canton of ZÃ¼rich Category:People from Winterthur Category:Living people
title: Rosmarie Kurz
